intro: Hieracium hafstroendense, commonly known as the Hafströms hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Scandinavia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine environments. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer, are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium hafstroendense is notable for its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions and is often found in open, sun-exposed habitats.
